Welcome to Mini 1569: The Golden Cookie Heist!

Luscious shortening... sumptuously smooth chips... crumbly to the touch... addiction in a jar. Ostentatious and proud and out in plain view for all to see. We all coveted for the Hotel Grande's prized treasure - their wonderful Golden Cookies.

They were meant to be shared on the hotel's 40th anniversary by guests and staff alike and were world-renowned for their extraordinary taste. But three people wanted them all to themselves...

This was the tale of the Golden Cookie heist.

Rules:

General:
Standard site rules apply.
Rules can be changed at any time and can be applied retroactively. If a rule is changed, all players will be informed in thread.
You may not enter a 'bah' post once killed – the dead don't talk.
If I make an error, please notify me.
Play to your win condition.

Day:
Day One will last for two weeks. Subsequent Days will be 24 hours shorter than the previous Day. If activity in a Day is particularly poor, I reserve the right to shorten deadlines further.

Night:
Night One will last for 72 hours. Subsequent Nights will last for 48 hours. When there are five or fewer players alive, Night can be ended early if all players choose to do so by sending me a PM.
Night actions should be sent by PM to me.
I will accept Night actions submitted in a Private Topic (if applicable) as long as they are clearly bolded.
Mafia members may submit actions on the behalf of others.

Activity:
A prod will be issued after 48 hours of in-thread inactivity. A replacement will be sought immediately if there is no post within 48 hours of the prod.
A total of three prods will result in eligibility for replacement. I will handle inactivity-based replacements on a case by case basis with the view of trying to maintain a good flow to the game.
V/LA should be posted in thread or privately messaged to me with a specific time frame in mind. Prods will not be issued to players on V/LA, although a replacement may be sought if a V/LA period is particularly long.

Voting:
Votes can be made using either the bold tags or the vote tags. e.g. Vote: Kalimar or VOTE: Kalimar
A lynch can be achieved with a simple majority of votes. e.g. 7 of 13.
A No Lynch will be achieved if the Day's deadline expires without a majority vote, or a simple majority of No Lynch votes is tallied.
Once a lynch has been achieved, the thread will be closed as soon as possible and the lynched's identity revealed before immediately moving into Night. You may talk in thread until the thread is closed.

Do Nots:
Do not attack other people on the basis of race, religion, background, etc.
Do not directly copy private communications into the main thread e.g. QTs, Private Topics or Role PM. Paraphrasing of these is allowed.
Do not discuss ongoing games within this thread.
Do not discuss this game outside of the game thread (except if allowed) until its completion.

Dos:
Follow the rules.
Read your role PM more than once to be sure you understand your role and win condition.
Ask me if you have any queries about the rules or the game.
Ensure I know if you are on V/LA and for how long.
Request prods on other players if they're in prod range and I've been lazy in prodding anyone.
Be active and have fun!

Sample Vanilla Townie PM:

Welcome, [player], you are a Vanilla Townie.

You have only your voice and your vote. Use them well.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town-aligned player alive.

Please confirm by replying by PM with your role.

Role PMs will be generated and assigned shortly.

UPDATE: All Role PMs should now be sent. Let me know if you didn't get one.

Since I'm trying out the Private Topics, I'll change the QT references in the rules to reflect that.

You have 48 hours to confirm - (expired on 2014-04-20 16:09:15). When 11 people have confirmed, the game will begin!

UPDATE 2: Eleven people have confirmed, so let's play!

1. To answer your question, let's live in the world of you being a paranoid scum player, temporarily. As such, if it was an error, I think it would most likely be you trying to not buddy so obviously with mnemonicdevice as a scumpartner. Since your post came only a minute after mnemonic's, you would try your absolute best to distance yourself from your partner- especially on opening day randomwagons, and as such you immediately regretted your decision, quickly distanced yourself, and then tried to vote him to relieve stress on yourself. The series of posts, especially with the follow-up to my initial Post 17 simply seemed like someone who was super eager and then realized that they did something really bad.

2. I think there are occasions where they are optimal. In day-before lylo scenarios, I think lynching extreme lurkers (emphasis on extreme) is often necessary if you can't rely on them to improve by the next in game day. The occasions concerning which I get behind a policy lynch are far and few between. That being said, I have no problem with the factual content of your post, but rather the reasons for your saying it. Similar to topic 1.), I think the context of your post was interesting. In such an early part of the game, generally speaking, first post comments are throw away or humorous, at least until further content is procured. I'm fairly certain Elyse wasn't trying to actually push for a policy lynch. Your response seemed just very pointed for day 1 D1 town play.

3. In reconsideration, 'arbitrary' was a terrible choice of words- as I stated in 2.), I feel that it was more so unnecessarily pointed.

As a player I'm not against making plays, but I always try to prioritize positive, clear communication between players foremost. Even if they're scum, getting into fist fights over whether or not I was being sarcastic 9 pages ago just makes for incredibly unhealthy next-day gameplay. I always want people to understand WHAT I'm saying. Mafia should be about the WHY. If we're running in circles about whether I'm lying about my original tone of voice, we most definitely are not going to be getting productive reads. Secondarily because I don't care about reads on him as of now. I wanted this discussion to be able to get a follow-up read on you after your interesting stream of posts. It is most important, in my opinion to get reads on the most vocal members of the game, because those are the people who lead wagons. As of now that's you and myself.

The setup was designedly a little swingy, since power was fairly nucleated. Every town power role had highly varying potentials in how useful they'd be; I really wanted them to pay dividends for people who made smart choices with them. I also wanted to try not to be totally cookie cutter in my allocations.

I liked the idea of the Weak Neighbouriser as it gave its recipient a choice between whether to try and find scum to suicide on, to verify a strong townie to work with, or perhaps shades of the two. Pim never sent in an action, so that role went nowhere. Perhaps another time.

The Odd-Night Role Cop was useful within the confines of this setup, but probably wouldn't be seen as a generally useful PR at all. I thought out of the town power roles that would be the one to get heat, and it had the potential to be an almost useless role. However, having the mafia power roles split meant there was more chance of him finding something useful to push on, particularly if it'd got to use its N3 shot and scum were ahead.

Vigilante can be fairly anti-town; in this case it was used fairly sensibly, but things could have gone a different way. It puts a lot of power in one person's hands! I mainly included this one for the fun factor and to keep mafia on their toes.

Mafia-wise, the power roles were split so as to not centralise them in one spot, and to add ciphers for the Role Cop to find. The Tracker was only truly reliable at clearing Vig prospects, and the RB was also only reliably useful for locking down the Vig -- if the situation called for it, of course. Whilst neither PR would be auto-guilty to the Role Cop if scanned, I felt it should make them see them as more likely guilty than not if they'd thought about things a little.

I'm happy enough with it for my first outing, I think! Thanks for playing. I may venture a themed game next time... we'll see.
